answers.answer: Ukrainian refugees can find out the steps needed to enroll their child in an educational institution by following the link provided on the page.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/education-useful-information and read the section under 'Information on how to enroll your child in an educational institution'.

answers.answer: Ukrainian refugee students who wish to continue their studies in Romania can find out the necessary steps by following the link provided on the website.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/education-useful-information and read the section under 'Information on how to enroll your child in an educational institution'.

answers.answer: The JRS Romania kindergarten serves preschool children, and their school is for first graders.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/education-useful-information and read the section under 'Kindergarten and school from JRS Romania'.

answers.answer: A child can be registered for classes at JRS Romania by calling 0744 405 657 or by sending an email to jrsromania@gmail.com.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/education-useful-information and read the section under 'Kindergarten and school from JRS Romania'.

answers.answer: The Angel Appeal Romanian Foundation offers various activities for children and a kindergarten, where education is free.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/education-useful-information and read the section under 'Kindergarten by Angel Appeal Romanian Foundation'.

answers.answer: The Angel Appeal Romanian Foundation kindergarten is open from Monday to Friday, from 10:00 to 17:00.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/education-useful-information and read the section under 'Kindergarten by Angel Appeal Romanian Foundation'.

answers.answer: One can sign up for the Angel Appeal Romanian Foundation kindergarten by calling +40723293769 (Camelia Raita) or +40770560741 (Oana Pasalan).
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/education-useful-information and read the section under 'Kindergarten by Angel Appeal Romanian Foundation'.

answers.answer: The “Ostrovok” Educational Hub in Bucharest covers grades 0 to 11th in Sector 2 and grades 0 to 6th in Sector 4.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/education-useful-information and read the section under 'The “Ostrovok” Educational Hub in Bucharest'.

answers.answer: The “Ostrovok” Educational Hub in Bucharest offers free classes for refugee students from Ukraine in the 2nd and 4th sectors.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/education-useful-information and read the section under 'The “Ostrovok” Educational Hub in Bucharest'.

answers.answer: The Ukrainian secondary school Taras Shevchenko in Maramureș is unique because it is one of the few secondary schools in Romania that offers teaching in the Ukrainian language.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/education-useful-information and read the section under 'Ukrainian secondary school Taras Shevchenko in Maramureș'.

answers.answer: Parents can get information on how to enroll a child at the Taras Shevchenko Ukrainian High School by contacting +40262 317 164.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/education-useful-information and read the section under 'Ukrainian secondary school Taras Shevchenko in Maramureș'.

answers.answer: Students can access and download free digital versions of Ukrainian textbooks for grades 1-11 for self-study via a link provided on the website.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/education-useful-information and read the section under 'For studying by yourself: digital textbooks'.

answers.answer: The Ukrainian Online School from the Ministry of Education of Ukraine caters to students in grades 5-11.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/education-useful-information and read the section under 'Online school from the Ministry of Education of Ukraine'.

answers.answer: The Ukrainian Online School provides free access to education for students and teachers from Ukraine through a platform that includes video tutorials, tests, and self-study materials for core subjects.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/education-useful-information and read the section under 'Online school from the Ministry of Education of Ukraine'.

answers.answer: UNICEF provides access to online platforms to support children's education, helping them continue their studies, develop new skills, and stay engaged in a structured environment.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/education-useful-information and read the section under 'UNICEF's Support for Children's Educational Journey: Access to Learning Platforms'.
